blocks.title: About you and people who live at {{ respondent.ru_name }}
blocks.description: In this section, we’re going to ask about you, and the people that live with you.

content.title: Information you need
list: Names of the people living in your household.
How they are related to you and one another.

questions.title: What are the names of everyone who lives in the {{ respondent.ru_name }} household?

content.title: Include
list: Students and, or school children who live away from home during term time

messages.MANDATORY_TEXTFIELD: Please enter a name or remove the person to continue
Please enter a name or remove the person to continue

questions.title: Is this everyone who lives at {{ respondent.ru_name }}?
questions.description: Please note that you will need to ensure that everyone is included because you will be unable to make changes later

options.label: Yes
options.description: This is the main residence of any other adults, children or babies, even if they are away for a continuous period of up to 6 months

options.label: No
options.description: This is not the main residence of any other adults, children or babies

questions.title: How is {{[answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name}} related to the people below?
questions.description: If members are not related, select the ‘unrelated’ option.</br>If you are the parents of adopted children, select the ‘Mother or father’ option to show your relationship to them.</br>If you have foster children living with you, select the ‘Unrelated’ option.</br>Include half-brothers and half-sisters in the ‘Step-brother or step-sister’ category.</br>Same-sex civil partner is used to describe the relationship between two people who have legally registered a civil partnership.</br>If none of the options fully reflects your relationship, please select the one which you feel best describes your situation.

blocks.title: You have successfully completed the ‘About the household’ section
blocks.description: In the next section we will ask you questions about each household individual.

blocks.title: {{[answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name}}
blocks.description: In this section, we’re going to ask questions about {{[answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name}}.

content.title: Information you need
list: Personal details such as date of birth, nationality, country of birth
How long {{[answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name}} has lived in the UK
Their national identity, ethnicity and religion

questions.title: Are you {{ [answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.middle_names[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name }}, or answering on their behalf?

content.description: An adult should answer on behalf of anyone aged 15 or younger.

options.label: No, I am answering on {{[answers.first_name[group_instance], answers.last_name[group_instance]] | format_household_name_possessive }} behalf

questions.description: If you were married (or formed a registered same-sex partnership) abroad, and this enables you to be recognised as married or civil partnered in the UK, complete the question reflecting that legal partnership.

options.value: Never married and never registered a same-sex civil partnership

options.value: Separated, but still legally in a same-sex civil partnership

options.value: Surviving partner from a same-sex civil partnership

questions.description: It is for the individual to choose their ethnic group. For example this could be their family or cultural background, or it could be how they would describe themselves.

options.label: White
options.description: Including English, Welsh, Scottish, Northern Irish, British, Irish, Gypsy, Irish Traveller or any other White background

options.label: Mixed or multiple ethnic groups
options.description: Including White and Black Caribbean, White and Black African, White and Asian or any other Mixed or multiple ethnic background

options.label: Asian or Asian British
options.description: Including Indian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi, Chinese or any other Asian background

options.label: Black, African, Caribbean or Black British
options.value: Black, African, Caribbean or Black British
options.description: Including African, Caribbean or any other Black, African or Caribbean background

options.label: Other ethnic group
options.description: Including Arab or any other ethnic group

when.value: Black, African, Caribbean or Black British

content.title: Please note:
list: by submitting your responses, you are declaring that you have completed to the best of your knowledge and belief.
if you do not submit, your responses will be automatically submitted.
after submission you will have an opportunity to provide feedback on your experience.
